answers.answer: Likely your symptoms are due to vitamin D deficiency and also calcium deficiency (vitamin D is essential to absorb calcium). The vitamin D deficiency symptoms would be muscle weakness, and the twitching and numbness due to calcium deficiency. Also make sure you have enough magnesium to absorb vitamin D.
Thanx, My vitamin D isn't as low as it use to be im on 50,000 of vd once a week. I will have her check that again next time i get to see her.
She thinks it maybe that since the degeneration is so server from the arthritis it maybe spreading and or causing the issue. Will be getting an x ray of my had so as i can get an appointment.

question: Going give a run by of my life. I am almost 29 year old female. When i was 4 i had my appendix removed, at 11 had my tonsils & adeoids removed, 18 had my son, 19 had my gallbladder removed, 23 had my daughter, 23 found cervical cancer, 24 removed, 24 tubs tied, 27 hysterectomy, 28 found out i have degenerative disc disease of the thoracic spine, 2 sliped disc lower part and middle of my back, sciatic, arthritis in my back, and vitamin d deficiency. Not but 5 months ago I had test liver, & kidney function fine, thyroid fine, no diabetes, count normal only the vitamin d was low. Left arm loses strength and hurts some times, both my thighs get muscle cramps and feel weak (dont know why)Now for the main question for the past year eyes and eye brows twitching which has gotten bad, now for the past 2 months my hand mostly my thumb will not to twitching it is all driving me insane. Beside my body absolutely hates me what is causing this cause i can't deal with it no more.
title: Hand and facial twitching
